newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said on Monday.

"The interbank rate eased slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly higher but bond prices were slightly lower. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.55/2.50 percent compared with last Friday's yield of 2.43/2.38 percent and one-year at a yield of 2.33/2.28 percent against 2.22/2.17 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$97.93/97.98 from last Friday's close of S$98.14/98.19, September 2001 at S$96.77/96.82 versus S$97.35/97.40 and June 2003 at S$95.48/95.53 against S$96.23/96.28.
The overnight interbank offered rate eased to 3-1/2 3-3/8 percent from last Friday's 3-5/8 3-1/2 percent.
